message_1:
Consider a fuzzy set A on a universe of discourse X = {1, 2, 3, 4}, where the membership function of A is given by:

µA(1) = 0.2, µA(2) = 0.6, µA(3) = 0.9, µA(4) = 0.7

Given the complement of A as Ac, evaluate the membership value of each element of Ac.

Find µAc(1), µAc(2), µAc(3), µAc(4).
message_2:
To find the membership values of the complement of A (denoted as Ac), we will use the formula:

µAc(x) = 1 - µA(x)

Now, we can calculate the membership values for each element in Ac:

µAc(1) = 1 - µA(1) = 1 - 0.2 = 0.8
µAc(2) = 1 - µA(2) = 1 - 0.6 = 0.4
µAc(3) = 1 - µA(3) = 1 - 0.9 = 0.1
µAc(4) = 1 - µA(4) = 1 - 0.7 = 0.3

So, the membership values for Ac are:

µAc(1) = 0.8
µAc(2) = 0.4
µAc(3) = 0.1
µAc(4) = 0.3
